overview:
A graduate of the Villanova School of Business with a degree in Finance, Brandon Miniman has been an enterprising individual and has dabbled with several entrepreneurial projects since high school. He owns a computer consulting business that services independent living facility for senior citizens, and has a client list that exceeds 300. He owns and manages pocketnow.com, which is the #1 Windows Mobile-focused portal as determined by Alexa ranking, which serves over a million pageviews and carriers a robust video channel of nearly 450 highly-rated videos. Because of his involvement with pocketnow.com, Brandon has been featured in Pocket PC and Smartphone magazine, and has been quoted by Gizmodo, Engadget, CNET, and other top tech publications. He and his websites have been recognized by Microsoft through the Mobius award and the Most Valued Professional award in 2007.

He is also Editor-in-Chief and co-founder of TechnoBuffalo.com, a next generation website for technology enthusiasts. TechnoBuffalo features magazine-style content, a proprietary tech-focused social network, and a sub-blogging platform that allows users to generate their own content.
